alert.note: Alert for Boone (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:35PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boone County through 530 PM CDT... At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boone Speedway, or near Boone, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and additional heavy rainfall of up to three inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Boone County, including the following locations... Luther and Ledges State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions remain favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
